description:
this canyon is described in limited detail in Canyons Near Sydney by Rick Jamieson. Help the Australian canyoning community by contributing track notes to ropewiki.com It is dry canyon and nice winter trip.

Approach

We did extra 2 abseils trough cliff line up to 20m each in order to walk in almost straight line from track to start of the canyon

Descent

R1: 25m sling RL R2: 30m bolts RR R3: 35m sling RC R4: 8m sling RR R5: 35m sling RL R6: 30m sling RR R7: 50m bolts RL R8: 20m bolts RL abseil lengths are estimated from rope lengths and/or eyeballing shorter drops

Exit

We did followed Colo and then Wollemi creek upstream to bend on -33.195°, 150.524° and then climb the spur up to Crawford lookout and then back to car. Another possible exit is following Colo river downstream for about 1.5km to Pass 6 and using this pass to get back on fire trail.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

https://ozultimate.com/tom/bushwalking/2009/20090418_colo_river/photos.htm

https://www.adventureswithm.com/2016/10/31/another-canyon-on-the-wish-list-bites-the-dust/

Background
name: Wounded Knee Canyon
